data.title: Drake Pokes Fun At Himself In ‘Laugh Now Cry Later’ Video With Lil’ Durk
authors: Brian Ives // Managing Editor, Beasley Media
data.meta_description: Drake plays a variety of sports of Nike's world headquarters in the new video for his collaboration with Lil Durk, "Laugh Now Cry Later."
data.text:
Drake just dropped his new song and video a few hours ago. “Laugh Now Cry Later,” featuring Lil’ Durk, was shot at Nike World Headquarters in Beaverton, Oregon

In the video, we see Drake playing various sports with some amazing athletes. He goes one-on-one with Kevin Durant, catches a pass from Odell Beckham Jr., and gets tackled by Marshawn Lynch; he also trains for boxing underwater and rides golf carts in the dark and drives a jetski.

He also makes fun of his own sensitivity: when he sings, “Sometimes we laugh, sometimes we cry, but you know now,” he gets interrupted while he’s crying. “It’s just been a long fight,” he explains. “But I’ve got to have a warrior spirit. I’m just regrouping. You got a tissue?”

Watch the video below.

Brian has been working in pop culture and media for about three decades: he’s worked at MTV, VH1, SiriusXM, CBS and Loudwire. Besides working as a writer and an editor-in-chief, he’s also appeared on air as a pundit, guested on radio shows and hosted podcasts. Over the years, he’s interviewed the surviving members of Led Zeppelin, the members of U2, Beyonce, Pink, Usher, Stevie Nicks, Lorde… and is grateful to have had the chance to interview Joe Strummer of the Clash and Tom Petty.
